name: DICLOFENAC SODIUM
indications: diclofenac sodium ophthalmic indicated treatment postoperative inflammation patients undergone cataract extraction temporary relief pain photophobia patients undergoing corneal refractive surgery .
contraindications: cataract surgery one drop diclofenac sodium ophthalmic applied affected eye , 4 times daily beginning 24 hours cataract surgery continuing throughout first 2 weeks postoperative period . corneal refractive surgery one two drops diclofenac sodium ophthalmic applied operative eye within hour prior corneal refractive surgery . within 15 minutes surgery , one two drops applied operative eye continued 4 times daily 3 days .
warningsAndPrecautions: diclofenac sodium ophthalmic 0.1 % ( 1 mg/ml ) sterile solution supplied white opaque ldpe bottle white opaque ldpe nozzle grey coloured hdpe closure . 2.5 ml fill supplied 5 ml size bottle . 5 ml fill supplied 10 ml size bottle . 2.5 ml - ndc72888-150-21 5 ml - ndc72888-150-22 store 15°c 25°c ( 59° 77°f ) . dispense original , unopened container . distributed : advagen pharma ltd. , east windsor , nj 08520 , usa . rev . 01/2025
adverseReactions: diclofenac sodium ophthalmic contraindicated patients hypersensitive component medication .
indications_original: Diclofenac Sodium Ophthalmic is indicated for the treatment of postoperative inflammation in patients who have undergone cataract extraction and for the temporary relief of pain and photophobia in patients undergoing corneal refractive surgery.
contraindications_original:
Cataract Surgery
                  
                  One drop of Diclofenac Sodium Ophthalmic should be applied to the affected eye, 4 times daily beginning 24 hours after cataract surgery and continuing throughout the first 2 weeks of the postoperative period.
                  
                     Corneal Refractive Surgery
                  
                  One or two drops of Diclofenac Sodium Ophthalmic should be applied to the operative eye within the hour prior to corneal refractive surgery. Within 15 minutes after surgery, one or two drops should be applied to the operative eye and continued 4 times daily for up to 3 days.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Diclofenac Sodium Ophthalmic 0.1% (1 mg/mL) Sterile Solution is supplied in a white opaque LDPE bottle with a white opaque LDPE nozzle and grey coloured HDPE closure. The 2.5 mL fill is supplied in a 5 mL size bottle. The 5 mL fill is supplied in a 10 mL size bottle.
                  2.5 mL -
 
  NDC72888-150-21

 
                  5 mL -
 
  NDC72888-150-22

 
                  Store at 15°C to 25°C (59° to 77°F).
                  
                     Dispense in original, unopened container only.
                  
                  
                     Distributed by:
                  
                  Advagen Pharma Ltd.,
                  East Windsor, NJ 08520, USA.
                  Rev. 01/2025
adverseReactions_original: Diclofenac Sodium Ophthalmic is contraindicated in patients who are hypersensitive to any component of the medication.
